summary: The Pecos Watershed Protection Act aims to protect the Pecos Watershed area in New Mexico. It withdraws specified federal land from mineral entry and designates the Thompson Peak area as a wilderness area within the National Wilderness Preservation System. The bill outlines the administration of the wilderness area, including provisions for grazing, fish and wildlife management, and the control of fire, insects, and diseases. It also addresses the incorporation of acquired land and further withdraws the wilderness area from mineral-related activities.
